00025 #include "OgreCylinderEmitter.h"
00026 #include "OgreParticle.h"
00027 #include "OgreQuaternion.h"
00028 #include "OgreException.h"
00029 #include "OgreStringConverter.h"
00030 
00031 
00032 /* Implements an Emitter whose emitting points all lie inside a cylinder.
00033 */
00034 
00035 namespace Ogre {
00036 
00037 
00038     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00039     CylinderEmitter::CylinderEmitter()
00040     {
00041         initDefaults("Cylinder");
00042     }
00043     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
00044     void CylinderEmitter::_initParticle(Particle* pParticle)
00045     {
00046         Real x, y, z;
00047 
00048         // First we create a random point inside a bounding cylinder with a
00049         // radius and height of 1 (this is easy to do). The distance of the
00050         // point from 0,0,0 must be <= 1 (== 1 means on the surface and we
00051         // count this as inside, too).
00052 
00053         while (true)
00054         {
00055 /* ClearSpace not yet implemeted
00056 
00057 */
00058                 // three random values for one random point in 3D space
00059                 x = Math::SymmetricRandom();
00060                 y = Math::SymmetricRandom();
00061                 z = Math::SymmetricRandom();
00062 
00063                 // the distance of x,y from 0,0 is sqrt(x*x+y*y), but
00064                 // as usual we can omit the sqrt(), since sqrt(1) == 1 and we
00065                 // use the 1 as boundary. z is not taken into account, since
00066                 // all values in the z-direction are inside the cylinder:
00067                 if ( x*x + y*y <= 1)
00068                 {
00069                         break;          // found one valid point inside
00070                 }
00071         }       
00072 
00073         // scale the found point to the cylinder's size and move it
00074         // relatively to the center of the emitter point
00075 
00076         pParticle->mPosition = mPosition + 
00077          + x * mXRange + y * mYRange + z * mZRange;
00078 
00079         // Generate complex data by reference
00080         genEmissionColour(pParticle->mColour);
00081         genEmissionDirection(pParticle->mDirection);
00082         genEmissionVelocity(pParticle->mDirection);
00083 
00084         // Generate simpler data
00085         pParticle->mTimeToLive = genEmissionTTL();
00086         
00087     }
00088 
00089 }
